The slot this layer is assigned to. If specified, and a slot with that name exists, it will be placed at that position in the layer order.

A measure of how much an individual point contributes to the heatmap. A value of 10 would be equivalent to having 10 points of weight 1 in the same spot. Especially useful when combined with clustering.

Only features that match the filter are displayed.

A measure of how much an individual point contributes to the heatmap. A value of 10 would be equivalent to having 10 points of weight 1 in the same spot. Especially useful when combined with clustering.
Interactive, thoroughly customizable maps for iOS powered by vector tiles and Metal.

Radius of influence of one heatmap point in pixels. Increasing the value makes the heatmap smoother, but less detailed.
on heatmap layers will return points within this radius.

Client-side hillshading visualization based on DEM data. Currently, the implementation only supports Mapbox Terrain RGB and Mapzen Terrarium tiles.

A styleâ€™s fog property is a global effect that improves depth perception by fading out distant objects.

but controls the intensity of the heatmap globally. Primarily used for adjusting the heatmap based on zoom level.

A spherical dome around the map that is always rendered behind all other layers.
Warning: As of v10.6.0,
is the preferred method for atmospheric styling. Sky layer is not supported by the globe projection, and will be phased out in future major release.
